name: Useful but Obscure Words Quiz | Vocabulary | 10 Questions

questions.text: A word meaning a certainly obvious 'impropriety'?
A 'Zeigarnik' is someone who has a strange tendency. What type of tendency is this, do you think?
questions.explanation:
remembering uncompleted tasks.

	Another of my favorite words is Zugzwang, a chess term.

questions.text: My girlfriend often complains that I may be suffering from 'Tragomaschalia'. What do you think I ought to do to rectify the problem?
questions.correct: wash under my arms more carefully
options: comb my hair to the left
questions.explanation:
wash under my arms more carefully.

	Trago-maschalia is to have smelly arm-pits...it does follow me around everywhere.

questions.text: Have you ever wondered what those little wings on Hermes' feet are called? Please select a choice below and find out!
questions.explanation:
Talaria.

	Talaria comes from the Latin - talus..which means ankles.

questions.text: Which word has the plurisignation of 'marginal utility'?
questions.explanation:
Ophelimity.

	Ophelimos (Greek) - Ophelimitat (German)..O'fee'li'mos- means perhaps to be profitable.

questions.text: A painful ache around the frontal and lateral parietal lobes is often called a __________?
questions.explanation:
Megrim.

	Headache comes from the Greek - hemikrania..which then was borrowed by the French - Migreime - reverting to the commonly seen word migraine.

questions.text: What is the ailment of a 'Gynotikolobomassophile'?
questions.correct: enjoys nibbling on a female's earlobes
options: has similar features as a woman
believes there are female angels near his head
questions.explanation: enjoys nibbling on a female's earlobes.

questions.text: What is an archeological object that is made of wood or clay and is decoratively disguised to resemble bronze?

questions.explanation:
Dyslogy.

	Dyslogy is to speak unfavorably about, while Zoilism is a nasty criticism.

questions.text: What is the psychic energy humans possess which is supposed to be even more powerful than nuclear energy?
questions.explanation:
vril.

	Some associate vril with the sacred word of Hinduism, Om. I wonder if the Taos hum is related to vril?
